mobs.long_desc: A hulking bouncer stands here firmly, blocking passage to the west.
mobs.desc: The man appears fairly strong, appearing almost stonelike in his stature. Dressed in heavy leather armor, the Custodian is ready for any skirmish, reflected by the wicked-looking shortsword hanging from his belt.  Looking out over the room, his vision flicks towards any trace of movement, his post as the cathedral's guard attributing itself much to his alertness.

mobs.long_desc: A dusty old man sits behind the desk, writing in large book.
mobs.desc: Ancient in appearance, and even more ancient in fashion sense, this man's tired wrinkles are filled with wisdom, though his eyes seem to glint with a slight hardness.  His only role in the cathedral is to maintain the supplies in the stockroom, a position it appears he has held for many years, perhaps even under the cathedral's previous management.  Keeping careful tabs on what comes in and out of this room, he knows what you need, and whether you really need it.

mobs.long_desc: Genois &b(&0&6Human&0&b)&9(&0medium&9&b)&0 is standing here.
Annira &b(&0&6Human&0&b)&9(&0medium&9&b)&0 is standing here.
Power cascades off the scales of a colossal black dragon.
mobs.desc: Bloated and massive, the gargantuan body of this dragon rests ponderously on only three legs, each ending in a vicious claw.  A stiff-looking brownish scar marks the spot where the right foreleg once stood.  The scar is the only blemish on an otherwise spectacularly beautiful skin of shiny black scales. Despite its apparent handicap, the dragon is definately at no disability, exuding an evident presence of calm and power.  A pair of long, membraned wings lie outstretched from his back, enabling deft, powerful movements.  A long, wicked tail winds out from the dragon's rear, lined with muscles to whip around as a weapon.  Mounted on a thick, sinewy neck, the dragon's head houses a brilliant row of sharply pointed teeth beneath bright, carmine eyes holding a powerful intelligence.  Filled with the knowledge and power of ancient Duclia, this dragonfather is not a force to be simply reckoned with.

mobs.long_desc: A sinewy golden dragon sits on its haunches, flicking its tail around.
mobs.desc: Lithe muscles ripple beneath this dragon's shimmering golden scales, a physical manifestation of his abundant power.  His body is long and elongated, easily stretching the length of a corsair.  From the posterior of the the massive body, a thick, whip-like tail swings about, brandishing a wicked looking set of spikes along the end.  Beneath the gargantuan dragon's body, four heavy, clawed legs support its massive girth, looking powerful enough to tear through a stone wall.  Two sinewy, membraned wings jut out of the dragon's back, stretched wide over its body.  A long, muscular neck snakes out of strong, broad shoulders, leading to an angular head with two large sapphire eyes, filled with intelligence and wisdom far beyond human comprehension.  Gouts of azure flame periodically flare from the beast's nostrils, singing the air around his body. Filled with the knowledge and power of ancient Duclia, this dragonfather is quite a force to be reckoned with.

mobs.long_desc: A slender copper dragon rests here, the look of a wild hunter in her eyes.
mobs.desc: The dragon's ruby-red eyes glint in the light, dancing with a ferociousness unseen in mortal creatures.  Her body is slender and lithe for a dragon, but a glance from her eyes promises more than a battle.  Brilliant copper scales line her body, a natural armor against physical attacks.  Powerful wings can be seen protruding from her back, but are currently folded close to her body.

mobs.long_desc: Authority emanates from the very scales of a brilliant silver dragon.
mobs.desc: Still quite young, this dragon nevertheless exudes great authority.  A simple glance of his emerald-colored eyes is enough to stop a man in his tracks.  The silvery scales of the dragon's body protect it from harm, thin only on his underbelly.  Striking there should prove to be quite difficult though, for he is well armed with a vicious set of teeth and claws powered by sinewy muscles and wings.

mobs.long_desc: A furtive bronze dragon glances around his body, watching for enemies.
mobs.desc: A bronze hide of thick armored scales, long scythe-like talons, and dextrous wings lined with muscules are all this dragon needs to stand, or fly, against his enemies.  His bright, aquamarine-hued eyes are furtive, seeming to watch all directions at once.  A crest of spikes run from the back of his head down the length of his neck, looking rather like a fierce mohawk.

mobs.long_desc: Lightning sizzles around the body of a steely-blue dragon crouching here.
mobs.desc: Power literally crackles about the body of this dragon, her supplely muscled body partially enshrouded by incessant flashes of lightning.  Her steely scaled skin seems to conduct the electricity, running up and down her long sinewy tail and neck.  Glowing crimson eyes sit in her head, reflecting extraordinary intelligence and constrasting with the blue-tinged hue of her scales.  Webbed wings protrude from her back, providing grace and strength to her movements.

mobs.long_desc: A drab, gray dragon stands here, eyes glazed and senseless.
mobs.desc: Shadows dance chillingly across the gray scales of this dragon's matte skin. Compared to other dragons, her form is rather unspectacular.  No brilliant shine marks her drab scales, no spiked crest runs the length of her body, and no life essence seems to be behind her two eyes.  She moves as if in a trance, all actions stiff and subconcious.

mobs.long_desc: Snorting toxic fumes from her nostrils, a youngish dragon sits here fidgeting.
mobs.desc: Hardly the size of an elephant, this young dragon has mostly silvery scales, their solid sheen broken only by swaths of pitch black scales, creating elaborate swirl patterns upon her body.  She looks anxious to prove herself, hissing softly as she looks around for enemies to destroy.  Her cerulean eyes are filled with a knowledge far beyond her years.

mobs.long_desc: The flickering visage of a green dragon quavers back and forth.
mobs.desc: Oscillating between this plane and countless other worlds, Theralmos has walked through the dimensions for generations.  His form seems solid and stable here, but a slight flicker hints that he may not always be present.  Although only here for infinitesimally small amounts of time, instantaneously jumping between planes, he is vanished for such a short period, it is as if he were never gone, enabling him to effectively be in many places at once.  The wings mounted on his back are relatively small, suffering from disuse, but a cool, collected look in his eyes suggests that he is not an easy target.

mobs.long_desc: The air itself sweats around the searing form of a magnificent red dragon.
mobs.desc: Shrouded in a heat-induced air distortion, the details on the massive form of an enormous red dragon are difficult to make out.  Four huge, blurry appendages can be seen, light glinting off what could be talons at the end of each.  Two immense wings stretch out behind the body, providing far more lift than an average dragon's.  Flares of fire are ejected from the dragon's mouth everytime it breaths, adding to the scorching atmosphere roiling off its red scales.

mobs.long_desc: Barely perceptible, the misty form of a dragon floats airborne like a cloud.
mobs.desc: Shrouded by an impenetrable wall of fog, this misty cloud dragon's gleaming light-blue scales can barely be seen, providing double protection to the dragon.  Two huge, webbed wings branch outwards from his back, undoubtedly providing tremendous lift, but the dragon seems to float without using them at all, as if it were lighter than air.  A long, sinewy neck projects from the dragon's shoulders, stretching a solid third of its entire length.  Atop its head two bright scarlet eyes peer out of the haze, beady dots looking deep into the souls of its opponents.  A chilly frost forms around the dragon's body, collecting on nearby objects and walls.  It is rumored that such dragons as this can change their form to a cloud to protect themselves from physical attacks, but few have returned from battles with mighty cloud dragons to support the tale.

mobs.keywords: dethylir dethylir-deceiver dark-metallic-sheen fluid-dragon mercury-dragon dragonquest
mobs.long_desc: Dark metallic sheen ripples across the scales of a fluid dragon seated here.
mobs.desc: The shining surface of this dragon flows and morphs, appearing as liquid one moment and scaly and solid the another moment.  Her entire body seems to be made from the same fluid substance, dark and metallic.  Bright crystalline blue eyes peer from her head, carefully watching the area.  Glossy metallic wings protrude from the dragon's mercuric back, giving her powerful lift and maneuverability.

mobs.long_desc: Pure magic swirls about the body of gigantic topaz dragon resting here.
mobs.desc: The colors of this beautiful crystalline dragon vary greatly across his gemstone hide.  The base color seems to be amber, with darker swaths of orange and sherry red.  Oddly enough, much of the dragon's body is covered in bright blue tattoo-like runes that form complicated patterns running about his torso and legs.  The runes seem to be a different color of the same gemstone, light refracting through them perfectly.  Large topaz wings protrude from the dragon's back, their webbing the same blue as the runes.  Black, glassy eyes watch all movements in the vicinity, looking, searching...

mobs.keywords: azurine azurine-terikrus brilliant-vitreous-sculpture massive-dragon sapphire-dragon dragonquest
mobs.long_desc: A brilliant vitreous sculpture of a massive dragon slowly turns its head...
mobs.desc: Sparkling like a colossal sculpture of bluish crystal, it quickly becomes apparent that this dragon is actually a living sapphire dragon, fabled by ancient lore and tales!  Slightly smaller than an adult gold dragon, his body is well-muscled and sinewy, scales glinting like a coating of a thousand gemstones.  Two beautifully smooth bat-like wings protrude from his back, stretching long enough to shield his head from damage.  Light streams through a ridge of clear sapphire plates runs along the dragon's back and tail, undoubtedly sharp enough to cut metal.

mobs.long_desc: A spray of seawater floats about an emerald dragon standing here.
mobs.desc: Slick scaled from a very recent dip in the seawater, this dragon gleams a brilliant emerald hue.  Light reflects off her gem-like scales, casting misty rainbows across her hide and into the air about her body.  A double ridge of sharp-looking spines protrudes from the dragon's back, appearing to waver slightly in the spray floating around her.  Two large blue globes look out from her head, double-lensed to provide perfect vision above and below water.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful dragon rests here, shining like sunlight on a placid lake.
mobs.desc: This dragon's entire body is translucent, refracting and reflecting light like a monstrous sculpture of crystal.  Other than its unusual material, the dragon appears as any other dragon: two large powerful wings, a long sinewed neck and tail, and a hide of luminous scales.  A swath of rainbow crystal run the length of the dragon, but whether it is truly variegated crystal or an illusion of the light is difficult to ascertain.

mobs.long_desc: Glittering a deep violet hue, a stunning amethyst dragon rests here preening.
mobs.desc: Smooth and glassy, the scaly hide of this dragon flows together like a single liquid mass of deep violet amethyst.  Darker streaks of indigo scales run along her dorsal side, wrapping around the smooth crystalline wings that protrude from her back.  The dragon's entire ventral side is a much lighter shade of mauve, giving her an adorable appearance.  A long serpentine tail snakes out from the dragon's hind-quarters, paralleled at the front of her body by a sinewy elongated neck on which the head is supported.  Her eyes are filled with wisdom and knowledge.

mobs.long_desc: A gleaming brass dragon throws a toothy charismatic grin your way.
mobs.desc: Softly glowing as if well-polished, the gleaming brass scales of this dragon provide both beauty and protection.  For a dragon, his body is quite slender, only a couple times wider than the neck and tail.  A ridge of shiny brass blades runs down his back, ending in a short series of wicked metallic spikes on his tail.  Two large webbed wings project from the dragon's back, and his eyes are full of shrewdness and intelligence.

mobs.long_desc: A monstrous sculpture of an iron dragon stands here slowly...breathing?
mobs.desc: A dull metallic gray, this dragon's outer hide resembles massive slabs of rough stony iron which overlap each other at the edges, giving her the appearance of a massive warhorse.  The softer ventral inner hide, also iron-clad, can just barely be seen beneath the slabs.  Gargantuan burnished metallic wings protrude from the dragon's back, each easily the length of her entire body.  Confidence fills the dark green eyes glowing beneath a heavy iron brow.

mobs.long_desc: Frost and snow collects upon the back of a snarling white dragon lounging here.
mobs.desc: Frost literally forms before your eyes on the white hide of this dragon, solidifying and cracking off as he shifts and moves.  A long white tail whips around behind his body, smooth and undecorated.  Frozen blood encrusts the wicked-looking gray claws on each of the dragon's four limbs, reflecting his tendency to be quite messy in battle.  Dull red eyes glow softly above his snout, filled with animosity and brutality.

mobs.long_desc: A blue dragon curls its sinewy neck around, looking contemplative.
mobs.desc: This dragon has a very smooth appearance, scales worn by many years of wind-blown sanding in the desert.  His eyes hold a terrible look of disdain, scowling at anyone who enters his vicinity.  It is said that blue dragons are the most territorial of all, and it looks as though this one is well equipped to defend his territory with a triple-spiked tail and lightning crackling from his scales.  Piercing crimson glow in his draconian skull.

mobs.keywords: argernis argernis-nevermore never-more skeleton-ancient-dragon dracolich draco-lich dragon-lich dragonquest
mobs.long_desc: The skeleton of a ancient dragon towers here, uttering incantations.
mobs.desc: Once a powerful dragon in its own right, this lich has studied the necromantic arts in horrifying depth, destroying its own body for the sake of immortality. The dragon's original color and gender are long gone, leaving only the skeleton of a powerful being bent on living forever.  Eminations of power roll off its bones, warning would-be opponents that this dracolich will not go down easily. Not after coming so far.  Like its living counterparts, this dragon has two large wings, but they lack webbing, making it difficult to raise any lift.  A litany of spells echoing from the lich's mouth compensates for it, allowing the dragon to achieve nearly any action through magic.

mobs.long_desc: A man dressed in a black-and-white striped suit blows a whistle here.
mobs.desc: Although his features are pretty ordinary, the man's black-and-white suit makes him look almost comical.  His continual blowing into a tiny metal whistle ensures it.  Three embroidered letters are on his suit's chest: CTF.  The back of his suit reads: REFEREE.

mobs.long_desc: A large marble fountain stands in the middle of the plaza.
mobs.desc: In the center of the fountain is a statue of Metamorpho, "Weaver of the Worlds." The statue's arms are extended toward the heavens, and water shoots out from its hands over the top of the statue's head. There is an inscription on the side of the fountain.

mobs.long_desc: Gleaming like the sun, a golden dragon sits on its haunches here.
mobs.desc: The brilliant golden scales of the dragon gleam brightly in the light, protecting its body from all manner of physical attack.  Its gargantuan form rests here ponderously, two large wings protruding sharply from its back, their leathery golden webbing the only part of its body not covered in scales.  Its large glassy eyes survey the surroundings apathetically, bored with the affairs of mortals.

mobs.long_desc: Shadowy as twilight, a black dragon flicks its tail around irritatedly here.
mobs.desc: A hulking shadow even in the light, the dark black scales of the dragon seem to absorb nearly all the light around its body.  The dragon's sable form rests here coyly, its tail wrapping around itself in a sinewy black knot.  Two huge, leathery wings stretch outwards from its back, flapping slowly with an annoyed beat.  The dragon's piercing red eyes invoke fear and loathing into the hearts of mortals.

mobs.keywords: dragonsquire squire dragon-squire pasty-skinned-boy young freckled
mobs.long_desc: Young and freckled, a pasty-skinned boy fidgets with an oversized sword here.
mobs.desc: With shortly-cropped, dusty-brown hair covering his head, this young man looks as if he belongs on a small farm, rather than lugging around a sword nearly as tall as him.  Heavily burdened by a complete set of knight's armor, he nevertheless looks quite spirited, energetic, and prepared to help.

mobs.long_desc: A brown-suited man stands here, speaking into a headset.
mobs.desc: A middle-aged man dressed in a brown suit, the FieryTag announcer looks out over the game with a sharp eye, watching every move the players make.  He announces important events into his headset, providing the many fans with second-by-second updates on the happenings and going-ons.

mobs.long_desc: Dressed in a handsome brown suit, a man jots words down on a pad of paper.
mobs.desc: Listening intently to the announcements around him, the FieryTag controller glances periodically at the row of images at the back of the room, jotting down many of the plays and actions occuring.

mobs.keywords: announcer fierytag fiery-tag brown-suited man fiery-tagged-announcer
mobs.long_desc: A brown-suited man stands here, speaking into a headset.
mobs.desc: A middle-aged man dressed in a brown suit, the FieryTag announcer looks out over the game with a sharp eye, watching every move the players make.  He announces important events into his headset, providing the many fans with second-by-second updates on the happenings and going-ons.

objects.ground: A parchment titled with the initials TCD lies here abandoned.

extras.text: This deed entitles the clan known as the Clandestine Degree to the following items as paid for in their initial construction costs so long as they continue to pay maintainance costs of 10% of the total construction costs by the 5th of each month. At the time dues are collected the seal on this lease shall be updated to reflect the date the next collection shall take place. Note- Lease agreements may be inspected at any time to verify that all dues are up-to-date. Clan Construction details follow and a Holy Seal is placed at the bottom.

The following are details surrounding the costs and maintenance of the clan's hall and item: Inital Construction cost (2 rooms)   - 15K Additional rooms (7)                 - 21K Shop with four basic items (18807)   -  7K One basic clan item (18801)          -  3K -------------------------------------------- Total                                - 46K Upkeep is 10% of total cost          - 4.6K
A holy seal is stamped at the bottom of this parchment. ,-.      .-, |-.\ __ /.-| \  `    `  / / _     _  \ | _`q  p _ | '._=/  \=_.' \()/ Dues paid through: July 5th, 2006 Collected by:

objects.short: a pair of black leather gloves
objects.ground: Smooth black leather gloves rest here, each hand branded by a blue fox.

extras.text: Sewn from the finest black leather, the gloves are smooth and perfectly flexible, fitting any hands exactly.  The gloves' inner lining is a soft cotton that keeps the hands dry without chafing.  On the backs of each glove, the dark blue emblem of a rearing fox is sewn in slightly glossy threading.  A tiny inscription encircles the emblem.
Encircling the emblem, the words '&4The Clandestine Degree&0' are inscribed in deep blue thread.

objects.short: a small cake of elven waybread
objects.ground: A brownish cake of bread is making a crumbly mess here.

extras.text: A brownish color on the outside and a cream color within, the small cake of elven waybread looks about as delicious as a bread can be.  Unlike other similar-appearing waybreads, this cake crumbles delightfully, releasing a scrumptious aroma.  It is rumored that elven waybread is far more nutritious than any human food, and that it is closely guarded by the elves and is only rarely awarded to others.

objects.ground: A large lemonade jug has been left here.

extras.text: Formed from the finest porcelain, this jug is glazed white with the blue emblem of a rearing fox on the front.  Below it, the word LEMONADE is imprinted.

objects.ground: A vermilion-hilted broadsword is embedded blade-first in the ground.

extras.text: Wrought from a dazzling black steel, the broadsword has a barely perceptible blue tinge, revealing its expert tempering and quenching.  The handle is wrapped with a bright vermilion cloth, providing padding and distinctiveness. The pommel is a large cinnabar counterweight, decorated with intricate designs. The edge of the blade itself is much sharper than usual swords, requiring little effort to injure or even disable an opponent.

objects.ground: A large vellum tome rests here, the image of a dragon on its cover.
A growling dragon tips a long golden scepter lying here.

extras.text: As long as a human is tall, this scepter is cast from the finest pure gold. About as thick as a forearm, the scepter is very heavy, seemingly designed for a grip much larger than a human's.  It is beautifully decorated, with many engravings and runes covering its surface.  At one end, a miniature dragon is sculpted onto the tip, its wings stretched wide.  The dragon's mouth is stretched open in a soundless roar, but it looks as though something is missing from its grasp.

objects.ground: A large, perfectly-cut ruby sits here glowing.

extras.text: The ruby is about the size of a troll's fist.  A circular groove runs along one side, looking like it could be screwed into something.

objects.ground: A growling dragon tips a long golden scepter lying here.

extras.text: As long as a human is tall, this scepter is cast from the finest pure gold. About as thick as a forearm, the scepter is very heavy, seemingly designed for a grip much larger than a human's.  It is beautifully decorated, with many engravings and runes covering its surface.  At one end, a miniature dragon is sculpted onto the tip, its wings stretched wide.  The dragon's mouth is stretched open in a soundless roar.

objects.ground: A long, thin rod of metal lies here, a glistening ruby adorning its end.
objects.action_desc: The ruby atop $n's staff glows, flooding the area with light!

extras.text: The staff is crafted from a long, thin rod of unidentifiable metal.  Its surface is perfectly smooth, with none of the knicks and wear typical of walking staves.  At the upper tip, a large, glistening ruby is mounted in what appears to be a dragon claw, moulded from the metal of the rod.  The staff is quite light, and seems to be very strong, undoubtedly somehow reinforced by magic.

objects.ground: A large black reptilian scale rests darkly on the ground.
A gleaming golden scale glints on the floor.
A gleaming scale of purest silver lies here forlorn.

extras.text: The scale is quite large, shed from the hide of a humongous reptilian creature. It shines like polished silver of the highest quality, and would undoubtedly be quite valuable on any collector's market.

objects.short: the bough of a Rhell tree
objects.ground: A huge branch with oversized leaves rests against the wall.

extras.text: The branch is huge, fallen from some unimaginably large tree.  It is wider than a human and its length is twice a man's height.  Huge leaves the size of shields hang off it, easily providing shelter or raw material.

objects.ground: A musky tallow candle lies here promising light and warmth.

extras.text: Moulded primarily from a mass of musky beef tallow, this thick candle promises hours of light, warmth, and odor.  Its wick is high-quality twine and dyed a blood red.

objects.ground: The beak of a seagull sits here, squawking silently.

extras.text: Recently torn from the face of a poor seagull, this beak still has some crusty, dried blood on its edges.  The beak is locked in a frozen squawk, forever crying of its death and mutilation.

objects.ground: Arcane energy crackles in a bright red sphere, hovering above the ground.
objects.action_desc: As $n takes hold of $p, it flares wildly!

objects.ground: A halo of glorious light shrouds a glowing blue sphere hovering here.
objects.action_desc: As $n takes hold of $p, it flares wildly!

objects.ground: A scaly multicolored book lies here, closed.

extras.text: The Duclian Draconium Avahern, the Chronicler

The cover reads, Duclian Draconium.  Images of different dragons are drawn across its face, depicting blue and crystal, good and evil alike.  Within, information on the Dragons of Duclia is listed, with the contents beginning on page1.

The Duclian Draconium 3.    Introduction 5.    The Dragons of Good The Metallic 7.         Gold 8.         Silver 9.         Bronze 10.        Brass 11.        Copper The Ferric 12.        Iron 13.        Steel-Blue 15.   The Neutral Dragons The Crystalline 17.        Amethyst 18.        Sapphire 19.        Emerald 20.        Topaz 21.        Crystal The Elemental 22.        Cloud 23.        Mercury 25.   The Dragons of Evil The Chromatic 27.        Black 28.        Red 29.        Green 30.        Blue 31.        White The Nebulous 32.        Shadow 33.        Silver-Black 35.   Appendicies 37.     The Guardians of Duclia 38.     Breath Attacks 40.     Special Talents 42.     Draconian Magic
This page is blank.

This Draconium catalogues the species of dragons represented in the Duclian senate at the time of writing, the 11th Day of the Month of Revolution, 14 MIE.  It magically updates itself, listing only the species of dragons surviving. The dragons are separated into three major groups based on alignment, and each of these further divided into two groups each, the true dragons and the supplementals.  For the first three sections, each page describes one species of dragon, listing their alignment, type, average length, breath weapon, any unique spells or skills they might exhibit, whether they have the ability to shapeshift, and their relative strength index. The relative strength index is a device the Duclian Organizational Force uses to rank species' relative powers.  It is only an average estimate. These lesser races of the Creator are estimated to rank between zero and ten, but no higher. The final section of this catalogue details the powers and effects of breath weapons, special skills, and draconian-specific spells.  The appendicies also contains a page that will magically renew itself, always reading the names of the current leaders of each draconian faction.  At the time of this writing, the great 27 Senator Dragons are listed. Avahern the Chronicler Royal Library of Duclia
This page is blank.

They are typically friendly creatures, exhibiting pronounced benevolence.  Gold dragons are known to live in any habitat, adapting quickly and easily.

&0=============================== &0&bSilver&0 =============================== Alignment:                   good Type:                        metallic Length:                      25-40 meters Breath weapon:               frost Unique spells:               metallurgy Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                yes Relative Strength Index:     70 Kind and magnanimous, silver dragons enjoy helping those weaker than themselves.  Silvers can often be found amongst the company of humans and elves.  Flying is a true pleasure to silvers, reflected by their preference of lofty mountain peaks for homes.

&0=============================== &3Bronze&0 =============================== Alignment:                   good Type:                        metallic Length:                      25-35 meters Breath weapon:               lightning Unique spells:               reconstitution Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     58 Bronze dragons are partial to deep water, enjoying aquatic food and company.  They are adept swimmers, able to travel nearly as fast underwater as airborne.  Justice is important to bronze dragons, who do not tolerate cruelty or anarchy at all.

&0=============================== &3Brass&0 ================================ Alignment:                   good Type:                        metallic Length:                      20-30 meters Breath weapon:               gas Unique spells:               hand of transport Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     55 Oddly, brass dragons are the most social of all dragons, even though they typically choose deserts to inhabit.  Some brass dragons will confine visitors only to keep them around longer to talk.  Sunlight and dry heat are especially pleasing to them.

&0=============================== &3Copper&0 =============================== Alignment:                   good Type:                        metallic Length:                      15-25 meters Breath weapon:               acid Unique spells:               defamation Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     45 Copper dragons have well-deserved reputations as pranksters, jokers, and riddlers, often staying out of the reach of opponents while shouting insults and abuses.  They are the most selfish and greedy of the good dragons.  Coppers often lair in dry mountain or hill caves.

&0================================ &9&bIron&0 ================================ Alignment:                   good Type:                        ferric Length:                      25-35 meters Breath weapon:               acid Unique spells:               iron maiden Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     59 Iron dragons' personalities usually match their steely hides, making them appear cold and unresponsive.  Nevertheless, they are strong-willed warriors of righteousness who never give up.  Their lairs are usually deep subterranean caves or abandoned mines.

&0============================= &0&bSteel&0-&4Blue&0 ============================= Alignment:                   good Type:                        ferric Length:                      30-35 meters Breath weapon:               lightning Unique spells:               bodily charge Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     64 Even more inflexible and relentless than their iron dragon cousins, steel dragons follow rigorous schedules and procedures, making excellent soldiers.  For their size, they are quite powerful, reflected by continual static crackling about their bodies.  Most steel-blue dragons lair in mountain caves.

They dislike conflict, and may even use their hypnotic abilities to prevent or stop combat.  Amethyst dragons are most likely found by remote mountainous lakes.

&0============================== &4&bSapphire&0 ============================== Alignment:                   neutral Type:                        crystalline Length:                      30-40 meters Breath weapon:               sonicboom Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                yes Relative Strength Index:     72 Sapphire dragons are very territorial, quickly attacking intruders on their stomping grounds without asking questions first.  This trait is aided by their ability to fly extremely fast and their superior hearing.  They typically live deep underground in self-constructed burrows.

&0=============================== &2&bEmerald&0 ============================== Alignment:                   neutral Type:                        crystalline Length:                      20-35 meters Breath weapon:               shockwave Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                yes Relative Strength Index:     64 Paranoid about the safety of their treasure, emerald dragons have multiple traps and alarms about their lair, which are often in dormant volcanoes.  As such, they are extremely heat resistant, and often shrug off a fireball as a gnat.

&0================================ &3&bTopaz&0 =============================== Alignment:                   neutral Type:                        crystalline Length:                      15-30 meters Breath weapon:               dehydration Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     53 Topaz dragons are unfriendly solitary creatures, disliking any kind of company, human or dragon.  They often lair near the sea, but have a slight aversion to the water, reflected even in their breath weapon.

&0================================ &7&bCrystal&0 ================================ Alignment:                   neutral Type:                        crystalline Length:                      10-25 meters Breath weapon:               light Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     43 The smallest of the gemstone dragons, crystal dragons are friendly and curious.  They lair in colder climates, where the skies are clearer, because they enjoy stargazing.  Crystal dragons have been known to adopt baby white dragons.

&0=============================== &6&bCloud&0 ================================ Alignment:                   neutral Type:                        elemental Length:                      40-60 meters Breath weapon:               lightning, frost Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     89 The largest of the neutral dragons, cloud dragons always lair in the clouds, the ability to turn themselves into a misty cloud allowing them to float effortlessly through the air.  Beginning as a whitish silver hue at birth, their scales slowly shift to muted sunset reds, oranges, and violets as they age.

&0============================== &9&bMercury&0 =============================== Alignment:                   neutral Type:                        elemental Length:                      20-35 meters Breath weapon:               gas Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               <none> Shapeshifter:                yes Relative Strength Index:     58 Mercury dragons have shiny hides, flowing liquid mercury making up their entire bodies.  They can harden or liquify at will, changing shape to anything, though they maintain their shiny appearance. These dragons are unpredictible and solitary, living in caves.

The Dragons of Evil The Chromatic 27.     Black 28.     Red 29.     Green 30.     Blue 31.     White The Nebulous 32.     Shadow 33.     Silver-Black
This page is blank.

&0================================ &9&bBlack&0 =============================== Alignment:                   evil Type:                        chromatic Length:                      25-50 meters Breath weapon:               acid Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               pounce Shapeshifter:                yes Relative Strength Index:     81 Usually lairing in swamps and jungles, black dragon's dark color helps them camoflague themselves.  As excellent swimmers, they subsist on an aquatic diet.  They are abusive, self-absorbed, and power-hungry, abandoning children and allies to save themselves.

&0================================= &1Red&0 ================================ Alignment:                   evil Type:                        chromatic Length:                      35-45 meters Breath weapon:               fire Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               claw Shapeshifter:                yes Relative Strength Index:     75 Red dragons are extremely greedy, arrogant, and vain, considering themselves superior to just about everything.  Many red dragons are obsessed with amassing their treasure hordes.  They are both exceptionally intelligent and fiercely territorial, living in temperate to arid hills and mountains.

&0================================ &2Green&0 =============================== Alignment:                   evil Type:                        chromatic Length:                      25-35 meters Breath weapon:               gas Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               pound Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     60 Green dragons are foul-tempered creatures, living in forests and regularly enslaving any woodland races in their territory with cruelty.  Usually solitary, green dragons, are nevertheless very protective of their young, fighting to the death for their safety. Cunning and crafty, green dragons concoct elaborate schemes to ruin their opponents, rather than attacking overtly.

&0================================ &4Blue&0 ================================ Alignment:                   evil Type:                        chromatic Length:                      20-30 meters Breath weapon:               lightning Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               sonicboom Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     55 Like the other chromatic dragons, blue dragons are extremely territorial, living in arid deserts where they can easily see long distances across their territory.  The sands keep their scales polished and glossy all their life.  Blue dragons are lawful evil.

&0================================ &7&bWhite&0 =============================== Alignment:                   evil Type:                        chromatic Length:                      15-25 meters Breath weapon:               frost Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               snow Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     43 The smallest and least intelligent of the chromatic dragons, white dragons live exclusively in cold places, especially icy and snowy locations.  White dragons are foolhardy and vicious, ripping their opponents to shreds before devouring them.  They like their food crunchy and frozen.

&0=============================== &9&bShadow&0 =============================== Alignment:                   evil Type:                        nebulous Length:                      30-40 meters Breath weapon:               <none> Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               shadow Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     71 Zombie-like and passive, shadow dragons rely entirely on instinct. With no higher intelligence, they are common targets for liches and psionics bent on world domination.  They are well-designed for combat, for whatever instinct they have seems to make them agile and vicious combatants.  Shadow dragons have the ability to turn themselves into massless shadows, immune from physical attacks.

&0============================ &0&bSilver&0-&9&bBlack&0 ============================ Alignment:                   evil Type:                        nebulous Length:                      15-30 meters Breath weapon:               acid, lightning Unique spells:               <none> Unique skills:               hypnosis Shapeshifter:                no Relative Strength Index:     50 Believed by some to be a bastard breed between black and silver dragons, in truth silver-black dragons are a rare species all their own.  They are fierce and extremely intelligent fighters, always anxious to inflate their pride.  They are not indigenous to Caelia, and have been known to attack Nymrill and Dheduu.

objects.ground: A mass of shadow lying here almost escapes notice.

extras.text: Formed of the essence of shadow itself, this amulet is darker and blacker than anything you have seen before.  Its very existence seems negated by its terrible blackness, a seeming void in the fabric of space.  Despite its utter absence, it has a shifty, shadow-like mass that is easy to touch, but impossible to grasp.  It somehow hangs upon a thick silver chain that looks strong enough to be swung about.  The amulet of course has no detail, being only shades of shadow, but it nevertheless seems to take on the form of a mounted dragon...or perhaps it is just a trick of the light.

objects.ground: A slender leather whip lies here patiently.
A black semicircular plate lies here, featureless.
A bright white wand reflects the light here.
objects.action_desc: $n holds the wand and utters a single word, 'insetcandusgjukamina'

extras.text: Short and stout, this wand is about the size of a bottle, but made of a solid shimmering white material.  Power runs through its length, manifesting as a light blue aura glowing around it.  On one end, a golden ankh is imprinted in the wand.

objects.ground: A jet black wand absorbs all light here.
objects.action_desc: $n holds the wand and utters a single word, 'insetgpuyh'

extras.text: About the length of a shortsword, this wand is rather large, but a tingling aura suggests that it may hold some unseen power.  Near one end of the wand, a ring of small runes wraps around the wand.

The writing on the wand is in an ancient elvish script and difficult to read, but seems to describe the wand's contract and usage.  Tapping the wand's power requires a binding and sacrifice as part of the contract with an unidentified being of darkness.

objects.ground: A stretchy-looking red loop of cloth sits on the floor.

extras.text: Sewn from some mysteriously stretchy material, the bright red armband has a fuzzy surface that snuggles softly against the skin.  A gray patch has been attached on one side with the emblem of a droplet of fire on it.  In tiny embroidered letters, the words "&1&bRED TEAM&0" appear below the emblem.

objects.ground: A stretchy-looking loop of blue cloth sits on the floor.

extras.text: Sewn from some mysteriously stretchy material, the bright blue armband has a fuzzy surface that snuggles softly against the skin.  A gray patch has been attached on one side with the emblem of a flare of ice on it.  In tiny embroidered letters, the words "&4&bBLUE TEAM&0" appear below the emblem.

objects.ground: A red swath of cloth is crumpled here.

extras.text: Attached to a thin wooden stick, the swath of red cloth is vaguely triangularly shaped.  With the large emblem of a droplet of fire on both sides of the cloth, it makes an effective flag.

objects.ground: A blue swath of cloth is crumpled up here.

extras.text: Attached to a thin wooden stick, the swath of blue cloth is vaguely triangularly shaped.  With the large emblem of a flare of ice on both sides of the cloth, it makes an effective flag.

objects.ground: A test staff sits here.
objects.action_desc: $n throws $p at $N, hitting $O in the nose! Test test.

objects.ground: A gleaming helmet with dragon wingtips on either side rests here.

extras.text: A gleaming shade of gold, the helm is surprisingly light, seemingly made of a gold-plated alloy.  The back of the helm is decorated with a brilliant etching of a dragon, and two sharp dragon wingtips jut out like ears on either side of the helm.  A shiny visor with fairly open eyeslits swings down in the front, providing extra protection from harm.  Power exudes from the helm, creating the impression that its wearer might be a very formidable combatant.

objects.ground: A shadowy helmet with dragon wingtips on either side rests here.

extras.text: A shadowy shade of sable black, the helm is somewhat heavy, made of a durable black steel.  On the back of the helm, an imposing dragon is etched in red, its crimson wings stretching outwards towards two sharp dragon wingtips that jut out like ears on eithre side of the helm.  A dark visor encloses the frotn of the helm, providing extra protection.  Power eminates from the helm, creating the impression that its wearer might be a very formidable combatant.

objects.ground: A large saddle sits here.

extras.text: A saddle built for a beast very different from a horse, the dragonsaddle is made of supple, tough leather, and brightly polished adamant metal.  The straps are decorated with gold thread interlaced into the leather, and the bucklers are shaped like tiny fangs and claws.

objects.ground: A huge glossy egg rests here, glowing with an internal light.

extras.text: It looks like an egg, but is far too large!  The outer surface is glossier than normal eggs, almost shiny and pearlescent in appearance.  A soft glow seems to come out of it, and periodically shadowy movements can be seen within it. Perhaps the egg could be hatched, revealing its contents.

objects.ground: A long ash bat is lying here, forlorn.

extras.text: Elongated and polished, the bat is carved of a sturdy ash.  It runs about the length of a human's arm, well balanced between the handle and barrel.  A long piece of cloth is wrapped around the handle, forming a cushioned grip just above the knob.  A vein of bright carnelian runs the length of the bat, a seemingly simple but powerful decoration.

A long piece of cloth is wrapped around the handle, forming a cushioned grip just above the knob.  A vein of bright carnelian runs the length of the bat, a seemingly simple but powerful decoration.

shops.do_not_buy: %s I don't stock things like that.
shops.missing_cash1: %s I don't stock things like that.
shops.missing_cash2: %s You'll have to give me something in return, you know.

shops.message_sell: %s Decent quality.  I like to keep these stocked.

triggers.name: Teleport_to_clanhall
triggers.commands: if (%arg% == out) if %actor.room% != 18800 return 1 oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% ducks quietly out of the room. osend %actor% Glancing around, you duck quietly out of the room. oteleport %actor% 18800 oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% suddenly fades into existance, walking in from the east. oforce %actor% look else return 0 endif else return 0 endif

triggers.name: Observe_other_room
triggers.commands: * * Observation trigger * Player supplies an argument which evaluates to a vnum.  The player * is then shown that room. * switch %arg% case inn set lookroom 3054 break case board set lookroom 3002 break case fountain set lookroom 3009 break default wsend %actor% Observe &bwhere&0? halt done wsend %actor% You peer out the window into the world below. wechoaround %actor% %actor.alias% peers out the window. wteleport %actor% %lookroom% wforce %actor% look wteleport %actor% 18802

triggers.name: Block_entry
triggers.commands: * * Block-Entry Trigger * Checks to see if player is coming from the east and wearing the cloak. * If not, doesn't allow entry. * if %direction% == east if %actor.level% > 99 || %actor.level% == elseif %actor.worn[12]% == 18801 wsend %actor% The TCD-GUARD squints at you and then nods and waves you in. wechoaround %actor% The TCD-GUARD squints at %actor.alias% and waves %actor.p% in. return 1 else wsend %actor% The TCD-GUARD puts his hand out in front of you. wsend %actor% The TCD-GUARD says, 'Hmmph!  Think again, buddy.' wechoaround %actor% The TCD-GUARD puts his hand up, blocking %actor.alias% from entering the guild. return 0 end else

triggers.name: test_trigger
triggers.commands: set var 50 wecho var is %var% if (%var% >= 1) wecho var more than 0 if (%var <= 99) wecho var less than 100 endif endif

triggers.name: xcast_xcast
triggers.commands: * * X-cast * This trigger works with 18821, x-decide, to cast custom spells with various * effects.  It may only be used by mobiles in the 18820 to 18842 range, * Laoris' dragonquest mobiles. * * Expected variables set by x-decide: *  xid - unique integer identifier, like 1 *  xname - name of the spell, such as 'arctic blast' *  xstars - duration to cast the spell, ie., 2 *  xmagic - magic words uttered at the end of the spell, like 'zimblo argis' *  xeffect - actual effect of the spell, such as 'damage' or 'expel' *  xmode - sets whether it's victim or self-only *  xamount - only meaningful for some spell types, ie., 100 * if ((%actor.vnum% >= 18820) && (%actor.vnum% <= 18842)) return 1 * Must use x-decide to select a spell first if (!%xname%) osend %actor% You have not chosen a spell to x-cast yet! * No x-casting damage on self, immortals, or people in other rooms elseif ((%xmode% == victim) && (%arg.name% == %actor.name%)) osend %actor% You cannot x-cast at yourself. elseif ((%xmode% == victim) && (%arg.room% != %actor.room%)) osend %actor% You must be in the same room as %arg.name%! elseif ((%xmode% == victim) && (%arg.level% > 99)) osend %actor% You cannot x-cast at immortals! else if %xmode% != victim set notarg 1 endif * Begin casting messages if (%xmode% == victim) osend %arg% %actor.name% starts casting &3&b'%xname%'&0 at &1&bYou&0!!!... oechoaround %arg% %actor.name% starts casting &3&b'%xname%'&0... osend %actor% You start casting &3&b'%xname%'&0... elseif (%xmode% == self) oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% starts casting &3&b'%xname%'&0... endif osend %actor% You start chanting... wait 2s * Imitate casting stars set stars %xstars% while %stars% > 0 if %notarg% || (%arg.room% == %actor.room%) osend %actor% %stars% remaining on %xname% wait 2s eval stars %stars% - 1 else set spell_stop 1 set stars 0 endif done * If player is still here, make with the magic if (%spell_stop% != 1) if %notarg% || (%arg.room% == %actor.room%) if (%xmode% == victim) osend %arg% %actor.name% stares at you and utters the words, '%xmagic%'. oechoaround %arg% %actor.name% closes %actor.p% eyes and utters the words, '%xmagic%'. elseif (%xmode% == self) oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% closes %actor.p% eyes and utters the words, '%xmagic%'. endif osend %actor% You complete your spell. if (%xeffect% == damage) eval damage %xamount% + %random.50% endif * Show the message if %xid% == 1 oechoaround %actor% &3%actor.name% lets out a &1soul-rending&3 screech&0! osend %actor% &3You let out shattering screech!&0 elseif %xid% == 2 oechoaround %actor% &7&b%actor.name% waves a taloned paw, bring down a &0&6bli&bzz&0&6ard&7&b of snow!&0 osend %actor% &7&bYou wave a taloned paw at the room, bringing down a &0&6bli&bzz&0&6ard&7&b of snow!&0 elseif %xid% == 3 oechoaround %actor% &7&b%actor.name% looks much healthier than before!&0 osend %actor% &7&bYou feel MUCH healthier than before!&0 elseif %xid% == 4 oechoaround %arg% %actor.name% waves a hand at %arg.name%, whisking %arg.o% away! osend %actor% You wave a hand at %arg.name%, whisking %arg.o% away! elseif %xid% == 5 oechoaround %actor% &7&b%actor.name% speaks a holy word of sanctification!&0 osend %actor% &7&bYou speak a holy word of sanctification!&0 elseif %xid% == 6 osend %arg% &9&b%actor.name% chants an arcane word at you, locking you in an iron maiden!&0 oechoaround %arg% &9&b%actor.name% chants an arcane word at %arg.name%, locking %arg.o% in an iron maiden!&0 osend %actor% &9&bYou chant an arcane word at %arg.name%, locking %arg.o% in an iron maiden!&0 elseif %xid% == 7 oechoaround %actor% &4Lightning streaks out from %actor.name%'s body, sizzling through the air.&0 osend %actor% &4Lightning streaks out from your body, crackling through the air.&0 elseif %xid% == 8 osend %arg% %actor.name% screams a commination at you, causing runes to appear on your skin!  (&1&b%damage%&0) oechoaround %arg% Runes appear on %arg.name% as %actor.name% screams an obloquy at %arg.o%!  (&4%damage%&0) osend %actor% You scream a curse at %arg.name%, causing runes to appear on %arg.p% skin! (&3%damage%&0) elseif %xid% == 9 osend %arg% %actor.name% flings a ball of caustic acid at you, burning your flesh. (&1&b%damage%&0) oechoaround %arg% %actor.name% flings a ball of caustic acid at %arg.name%, burning %actor.p% flesh.  (&4%damage%&0) osend %actor% You throw a ball of caustic acid at %arg.name%, burning %arg.p% flesh. (&3%damage%&0) else oechoaround %actor% X-cast failure.  Nothing happens. osend %actor% Unrecognized xid number. endif * Do the deed if (%xeffect% == damage) odamage %arg% %damage% elseif (%xeffect% == heal) oheal %actor% %xamount% endif if (%xeffect% == transport) if (%xamount% == -1) osend %arg% %actor.name% waves a hand at you, whisking you away! set max_tries 20 while %max_tries% > 0 oteleport %arg% %random.60000% if %arg.room% != %actor.room% set max_tries 0 endif eval max_tries %max_tries% - 1 done if !%max_tries% oteleport %arg% 0 endif else oteleport %arg% %xamount% endif oforce %arg% look elseif (%xeffect% == area) set max_tries 20 while %max_tries% > 0 set victim %random.char% if %victim% if (%victim.vnum% != %actor.vnum%) && !(%target_list% /= X%victim.name%X) set target_list %target_list%X%victim.name%X eval damage %xamount% + %random.50% if %xid% == 1 osend %victim% &3The screech pierces into your head, causing great pain!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) oechoaround %victim% &3%victim.name% grasps %victim.p% head in pain.&0 (&4%damage%&0) odamage %victim% %damage% elseif %xid% == 2 osend %victim% &6The sudden blizzard &7&bchills&0&6 you to the bone!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) oechoaround %victim% &6%victim.name% shivers and turns blue in the blizzard.&0 (&4%damage%&0) odamage %victim% %damage% elseif (%xid% == 5) && (%victim.align% <= -350) osend %victim% &7&bYou cry out in pain upon hearing %actor.name%'s blessing!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) oechoaround %victim% &7&b%victim.name% grasps %victim.p% head upon hearing %actor.name%'s blessing!&0 (&4%damage%&0) odamage %victim% %damage% elseif %xid% == 7 osend %victim% &4The lightning strikes you in the chest, shocking your body!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) oechoaround %victim% &4%victim.name% reels back, struck in the chest by the lightning!&0 (&4%damage%&0) odamage %victim% %damage% endif endif else set max_tries 0 endif eval max_tries %max_tries% - 1 done endif else set spell_stop 1 endif endif * If the player left somewhere along the way, fail spell if (%spell_stop% == 1) osend %actor% You stop invoking abruptly! oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% stops invoking abruptly! endif endif else * Do nothing for non-dragonquest mobs return 0 endif

triggers.name: xcast_xdecide
triggers.commands: * * X-decide * This trigger works with 18820, x-cast, to cast custom spells with various * effects.  It may only be used by mobiles in the 18820 to 18842 range, * Laoris' dragonquest mobiles. * * Expected variables set by x-decide: *  xid - unique integer identifier, like 1 *  xname - name of the spell, such as 'arctic blast' *  xstars - duration to cast the spell, ie., 2 *  xmagic - magic words uttered at the end of the spell, like 'zimblo argis' *  xeffect - actual effect of the spell, such as 'damage' or 'expel' *  xmode - sets whether it's victim or self-only *  xamount - only meaningful for some spell types, ie., 100 * if ((%actor.vnum% >= 18820) && (%actor.vnum% <= 18842)) * Block 'Huh?!?' message return 1 * Choose spell * These if statements allow the user to only type part of the spell * name, such as just 'arc' for 'arctic blast'.  However, this also * allows 'blast', so making another spell 'blast of fire' is a bad * idea.  Use unique spell names. if (deadly screech /= %arg%) set xid 1 set xname deadly screech set xstars 0 set xmagic shelak frhoonl set xeffect area set xmode self set xamount 300 elseif (blizzard /= %arg%) set xid 2 set xname blizzard set xstars 2 set xmagic shelaki set xeffect area set xmode self set xamount 300 elseif (reconstitution /= %arg%) set xid 3 set xname reconstitution set xstars 2 set xmagic mellagenipoir set xeffect heal set xmode self set xamount 1000 elseif (hand of transport /= %arg%) set xid 4 set xname hand of transport set xstars 2 set xmagic franti ay sakchorish set xeffect transport set xmode victim set xamount -1 elseif (defamation /= %arg%) set xid 5 set xname defamation set xstars 2 set xmagic rotulugeaf set xeffect area set xmode self set xamount 400 elseif (iron maiden /= %arg%) set xid 6 set xname iron maiden set xstars 1 set xmagic grak oblithron set xeffect transport set xmode victim set xamount 18820 elseif (bodily charge /= %arg%) set xid 7 set xname bodily charge set xstars 3 set xmagic corpeno elekar set xeffect area set xmode self set xamount 500 elseif (archons curse /= %arg%) set xid 8 set xname archons curse set xstars 2 set xmagic colrio goladhr set xeffect damage set xmode victim set xamount 500 elseif (caustic conflaguration /= %arg%) set xid 9 set xname caustic conflaguration set xstars 2 set xmagic akridsi donoeplarinius set xeffect damage set xmode victim set xamount 300 else osend %actor% That is not a valid x-cast spell. endif if %xname% osend %actor% x-cast spell set to: %xname% global xname endif if %xid% global xid endif if %xstars% global xstars endif if %xmagic% global xmagic endif if %xeffect% global xeffect endif if %xmode% global xmode endif if %xamount% global xamount endif else * Do nothing for non-dragonquest mobs return 0 endif

triggers.name: scepter_reform
triggers.commands: if (%self.vnum% == 18822 && %actor.wearing[18823]%) || (%self.vnum% == 18823 && %actor.wearing[18822]%) wait 1 oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% places the ruby in the mouth of the scepter's dragon. osend %actor% You place the ruby in the mouth of the dragon. oecho The ruby flares, and the scepter begins to glow &1red&0. wait 1s oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% yelps as the scepter burns %actor.o%, dropping it! osend %actor% The scepter burns you, and you drop it! if %self.vnum% == 18822 opurge ruby-duclia elseif %self.vnum% == 18823 opurge scepter-duclia endif oload obj 18824 opurge %self% endif

triggers.name: xcast_xlist
triggers.commands: * * X-list * This trigger lists the spells available to x-decide and x-cast, triggers * 18820 and 18821.  It may only be used by mobiles in the 18820 to 18842 * range, Laoris' dragonquest mobiles. * if ((%actor.vnum% >= 18820) && (%actor.vnum% <= 18842)) return 1 osend %actor% X-cast spells:           type       stars  amount osend %actor% &0 deadly screech          area       0      300 osend %actor% &0 blizzard                area       2      300 osend %actor% &0 reconstitution          heal       2      1000 osend %actor% &0 hand of transport       transport  2 osend %actor% &0 defamation              area       2      400 osend %actor% &0 iron maiden             transport  1 osend %actor% &0 bodily charge           area       3      500 osend %actor% &0 archons curse           damage     2      500 osend %actor% &0 caustic conflaguration  damage     2      300 else return 0 endif

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: return 0

triggers.name: shapeshift
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case s case sh case sha return 0 halt done switch %actor.vnum% case 18820 set mob_vnum 18822 set mob_name pryrian-duclia set shape_name the shape of a gargantuan black dragon set obj_vnum 18826 break case 18821 set mob_vnum 18823 set mob_name eralshar-duclia set shape_name the shape of a sinewy golden dragon set obj_vnum 18827 break case 18822 set mob_vnum 18820 set mob_name human-pryrian set shape_name human form set obj_vnum 18820 break case 18823 set mob_vnum 18821 set mob_name human-eralshar set shape_name human form set obj_vnum 18825 break default return 0 halt done oecho The cracks of bones reforming are heard as %actor.name% takes %shape_name%. oload mob %mob_vnum% oforce %mob_name% mload obj %obj_vnum% osend %actor% Loaded %mob_name%; ready to be switched into. opurge %actor% opurge %self%

triggers.name: block_wield
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case w return 0 halt done osend %actor% You cannot wield another weapon with %self.shortdesc%!

triggers.name: **UNUSED**
triggers.commands: return 0

triggers.name: talon_wear
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_variable[quest_items:%self.vnum%]% if !(%actor.worn[wield]%) && !(%actor.worn[wield2]%) && !(%actor.worn[2hwield]%) return 1 else return 0 osend %actor% You cannot wield another weapon with %self.shortdesc%! endif else return 0 osend %actor% You do not feel worthy enough to wield %self.shortdesc%! endif

triggers.name: globe_drop
triggers.commands: return 1 set owner %actor.name% global owner oechoaround %actor% %self.shortdesc% hovers away from %actor.name% slowly. osend %actor% %self.shortdesc% slowly hovers away from you.

triggers.name: globe_get
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_variable[quest_items:%self.vnum%]% if %owner% if %owner% == %actor.name% if !(%actor.worn[held]%) && !(%actor.worn[wield]%) && !(%actor.worn[2hwield]%) set last_use %actor.quest_variable[quest_items:globe%self.vnum%_time]% set now %time.stamp% if %last_use% if %now% - %last_use% >= 1 set can_use yes else return 1 oecho %self.shortdesc% flares brightly, but then fades. endif else set can_use yes endif if %can_use% == yes return 0 oload obj %self.vnum% oforce %actor% get globe oforce %actor% hold globe oforce %actor% use globe quest variable quest_items %actor.name% globe%self.vnum%_time %now% opurge %self% endif else return 1 osend %actor% You must have your primary hand free to activate %self.shortdesc%. endif else return 0 osend %actor% %self.shortdesc%: you can't take that! endif else return 1 endif else return 0 osend %actor% %self.shortdesc%: you can't take that! endif

attempted 1 endif eval max_tries %max_tries% - 1 done if %attempted% halt endif endif if (%is_war% || %is_ran% || %is_pal% || %is_ant% || %is_mer%) && (%level% - %actor.level% >= 0) && (%self.worn[11]% != -1) bash elseif (%is_ass% || %is_thi% || (%is_rog% && (%level% > 9)) || (%is_mer% && (%level% > 10))) && (%self.worn[16]% != -1) backstab elseif (%is_war% && (%level% > 49)) || ((%is_pal% || %is_ant%) && (%level% > 79)) hitall elseif ((%is_war% || %is_ran% || %is_pal% || %is_ant% || %is_mon% || %is_mer%) && (%level% >= 1)) || (%is_ass% && (%level% >= 36)) kick endif halt endif * Initalize chance to do support spells if !%defensive% set defensive 5 global defensive endif * Attempt to cast support spells if %mode% <= %defensive% if ((%is_nec% && %cir_7%) || (%is_arc% && else set mode 6 endif endif if %mode% > 5 if (%is_sor% || %is_cry%) && %cir_8% cast 'chain lightning' elseif %is_pyr% && %cir_6% cast 'firestorm' elseif (%is_sor% || %is_cry%) && %cir_6% cast 'ice %cir_9%) || (%is_ant% && %cir_11%)) cast 'unholy word' elseif %is_sor% && %cir_9% && %mode% <= 2 cast 'disintegrate' *   elseif %is_cry% && %cir_9% *      cast 'iceball' *   elseif %is_pyr% && %cir_9% elseif %is_div% && !%is_dru% cast 'cause light' endif endif set action %now% global action

triggers.name: ctf_armband_tag
triggers.commands: **** Set vnum variables **** * Mobiles set referee 18880 * Objects set vnum_a 18880 set vnum_b 18881 set flag_a 18882 set flag_b 18883 * Rooms set zone_a_start 3500 set zone_a_end 3599 set jail_a 18880 set home_a 3500 set flag_room_a 3500 set zone_b_start 8000 set zone_b_end 8199 set jail_b 18881 set home_b 8025 set flag_room_b 8050 * Player has been forced to deactivate their armband if (%arg% == DeactivateArmband) set inactive yes global inactive * Player has been forced to reactivate their armband elseif (%arg% == ReactivateArmband) set inactive no global inactive * Player is wearing an inactive armband elseif (%inactive% == yes) osend %actor% Sorry, you can't tag anyone right now! * Player tries to tag self elseif ((%arg% == self) || (%actor.name% == %arg.name%)) osend %actor% There's really no point to that, now is there? * Player tries to tag someone who isn't in room or doesn't exist elseif (%arg.room% != %actor.room%) osend %actor% Tag whom?  They're not here! * Player tries to tag immortal elseif (%arg.level% > 99) osend %actor% It's not very nice to tag immortals. * Player is holding the flag elseif (%actor.wearing[%flag_a%]%) || (%actor.wearing[%flag_b%]%) osend %actor% You cannot tag someone while holding the flag! * Player tries to tag player or referee mob elseif ((%arg.vnum% == -1) || (%arg.vnum% == %referee%)) * Player tries to tag someone on team A if (%arg.wearing[%vnum_a%]%) eval arg_team %vnum_a% * Player tries to tag someone on team B elseif (%arg.wearing[%vnum_b%]%) eval arg_team %vnum_b% * Player tries to tag someone who isn't playing else osend %actor% %arg.name% doesn't seem to be playing. endif * Player tries to tag someone who is playing if (%arg_team%) * Player is on team A if (%self.vnum% == %vnum_a%) eval actor_home %home_a% eval actor_jail %jail_a% eval actor_flag_room %flag_room_a% eval actor_flag %flag_a% * Player is in home zone if ((%actor.room% >= %zone_a_start%) && (%actor.room% <= %zone_a_end%)) set at_home yes endif * Player is on team B elseif (%self.vnum% == %vnum_b%) eval actor_home %home_b% eval actor_jail %jail_b% eval actor_flag_room %flag_room_b% eval actor_flag %flag_b% * Player is in home zone if ((%actor.room% >= %zone_b_start%) && (%actor.room% <= %zone_b_end%)) set at_home yes endif endif * Player tries to tag someone in jail if ((%actor.room% == %jail_a%) || (%actor.room% == %jail_b%)) set in_jail yes endif * Player tries to tag someone on the same team if (%arg_team% == %self.vnum%) * Player tags teammate in jail (Return both to team home room) if (%in_jail% == yes) oteleport %arg% %actor_home% osend %arg% %actor.name% tags you, rescuing you from jail! oechoaround %arg% %actor.name% appears in a bright flash of light! oechoaround %arg% %arg.name% appears in a bright flash of light! oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tags %arg.name%, rescuing %arg.o% from jail! osend %actor% You tag %arg.name%, rescuing %arg.o% from jail! oteleport %actor% %actor_home% oforce %arg% tag ReactivateArmband oforce %actor% look oforce %arg% look * Player tries to tag teammate in home zone elseif (%at_home% == yes) osend %actor% %arg.name% doesn't need saving in your own zone! * Player tries to tag teammate not in home zone, but not in jail else osend %actor% %arg.name% doesn't need saving right now! endif * Player tries to tag someone on an enemy team else * Player tries to tag enemy in jail if (%in_jail% == yes) * Player tries to tag enemy in player's jail if (%actor.room% == %actor_jail%) osend %actor% %arg.name% is already in your jail! * Player tags enemy in enemy's jail (Send enemy to jail and player to home) else oteleport %arg% %actor_jail% osend %arg% %actor.name% tags you, banishing you for jail-guarding! oechoaround %arg% %arg.name% appears in a bright flash of light! oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tags %arg.name%, banishing %arg.o% for jail-guarding! osend %actor% You tag %arg.name%, banishing %arg.o% for jail-guarding! oteleport %actor% %actor_home% oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% appears in a bright flash of light! oforce %arg% tag DeactivateArmband oforce %actor% look oforce %arg% look endif * Player tries to tag enemy in player's flag room elseif (%actor.room% == %actor_flag_room%) osend %actor% You can't tag %arg.name% in your flag room! * Player tags enemy in player's zone (Send enemy to player's jail) elseif (%at_home% == yes) osend %arg% %actor.name% tags you, sending you to %actor.o% jail! oteleport %arg% %actor_jail% oechoaround %arg% %arg.name% appears in a bright flash of light! oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tags %arg.name%, sending %arg.o% to jail! osend %actor% You tag %arg.name%, sending %arg.o% to your jail! oforce %arg% tag DeactivateArmband oforce %arg% look * Player tries to tag enemy outside of player's zone else osend %actor% Tagging %arg.name% has no effect outside your zone! endif * Player tags enemy holding flag if (%arg.wearing[%flag_a%]) || (%arg.wearing[%flag_b%]%) set actor_room %actor.room% oforce %arg% remove ctf-flag oteleport %actor% %actor_flag_room% oload obj %actor_flag% oteleport %actor% %actor_room% endif endif endif * Player tries to tag other mob else osend %actor% You can only tag players! endif

triggers.name: ctf_flag_get
triggers.commands: **** Set vnum variables **** * Mobiles set referee 18880 * Objects set vnum_a 18880 set vnum_b 18881 set flag_a 18882 set flag_b 18883 * Player is on team A if (%actor.wearing[18880]%) * Player is trying to pick up team A's flag if (%self.vnum% != %flag_a%) set enemy_flag yes endif * Player is on team B elseif (%actor.wearing[18881]) * Player is trying to pick up team B's flag if (%self.vnum% != %flag_b%) set enemy_flag yes endif endif if (%enemy_flag% == yes) set hands 0 if (%actor.worn[held]%) set hands 1 endif if (%actor.worn[held2]%) eval hands %hands% + 1 endif if (%actor.worn[wield]%) eval hands %hands% + 1 endif if (%actor.worn[wield2]%) eval hands %hands% + 1 endif if (%actor.worn[2hwield]) eval hands %hands% + 1 endif if (%actor.worn[shield]%) set hands 2 endif if (%hands% < 2) return 1 wait 1 oforce %actor% hold flag else return 0 osend %actor% You must have a free hand to pick up the flag! endif else return 0 osend %actor% You can't pick that up! endif

triggers.name: ctf_flag_pass
triggers.commands: **** Set vnum variables **** * Mobiles set referee 18880 * Objects set vnum_a 18880 set vnum_b 18881 * Rooms set flag_room_a 3520 set flag_room_b 8600 * Player tries to pass to self if ((%arg% == self) || (%actor% == %arg%)) osend %actor% There's really no point to that, now is there? * Player tries to pass to someone who isn't in room or doesn't exist elseif (%arg.room% != %actor.room%) osend %actor% Pass the flag to whom?  They're not here! * Player tries to pass to an immortal elseif (%arg.level% > 99) osend %actor% You can't pass to an immortal! * Player tries to pass to a player or the referee mob elseif ((%arg.vnum% == -1) || (%arg.vnum% == %referee%)) * Player tries to pass to someone on team A if (%arg.wearing[%vnum_a%]%) eval arg_team %team_a% * Player tries to pass to someone on team B elseif (%arg.wearing[%vnum_b%]%) eval arg_team %team_b% * Player tries to pass to someone who isn't playing else osend %actor% %arg.name% doesn't seem to be playing. endif * Player passes to someone who is playing if (%arg_team%) * Player is on team A if (%self.vnum% == %vnum_a%) eval actor_flag_room %flag_room_a% * Player is on team B elseif (%self.vnum% == %vnum_b%) eval actor_flag_room %flag_room_b% endif * Player passes to someone on the same team if (%arg_team% == %self.vnum%) osend %arg% %actor.name% quickly passes %self.shortdesc% to you. oteleport %arg% 0 osend %actor% You slyly hand off %self.shortdesc% to %arg.name%. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% quietly passes a flag to %arg.name%. oteleport %arg% %actor.room% oload obj %self.vnum% oforce %arg% get ctf-flag opurge %self% * Player passes to someone on an enemy team (Reset flag) else osend %actor% You accidentally pass the flag to %arg.name%, resetting it. oteleport %actor% %actor_flag_room% oload obj %self.vnum% oteleport %actor% %arg.room% opurge %self% endif endif * Player tries to pass to other mob else osend %actor% You can only pass the flag to players! endif

triggers.name: quest_item_binding
triggers.commands: * This trigger checks if a player is "registered" to wear certain quest eq. * In order to be registered, a player must have the quest_items quest and a * quest variable whose name is the vnum of the object this trigger is on * and whose value is true (a simple 1 or yes will suffice). * * To register a player for equipment, first check to see if they already have * the quest_item quest by typing "quest stage quest_items <player>" in their * presence.  If they do not have it or it is failed, it will say failed.  In * this case, attempt to start or restart quest_items on the player ("quest * start quest_items <player>" and "quest restart quest_items <player>").  If * the 'quest stage' command said anything besides failed, the player is ready! * * Once a player has the quest_items quest active, add a quest variable for * the object.  For instance, if I wanted to allow Laoris to wear a golden * dragonhelm, I would type: * *     quest variable quest_items laoris 18890 1 * * If I no longer want Laoris to be able to wear the helm, I would type: * *     quest variable quest_items laoris 18890 0 * if %actor.quest_variable[quest_items:%self.vnum%]% return 1 else return 0 if %self.type% == WEAPON osend %actor% You do not feel worthy enough to wield %self.shortdesc%! else osend %actor% You do not feel worthy enough to wear %self.shortdesc%! endif endif

triggers.name: DoRemortQuest
triggers.argument_list: Yes, I am sure I want to remort.
triggers.commands: if (%actor.level% == 99) msend %actor% Your remort will take effect in 30 seconds. mforce %actor% petition I am committing a REMORT! mforce %actor% petition After this completes, I will need my class reset to my base class. mforce %actor% petition The deleveling will begin in 30 seconds. mforce %actor% petition Kill the RemortQuestHandler before then to cancel the remort. wait 30s wizn Now starting! while (%actor.level% > 1) set count 99 while ((%actor.level% > 1) && (%count% > 2)) mexp %actor% -500000 eval count %count% - 1 done done mforce %actor% forget all else msend %actor% You do not have enough experience to remort! endif mpurge %self%

triggers.name: summon_dragon
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case s case su return 0 halt done set last_summon %actor.quest_variable[quest_items:dragonhelm_time]% eval now ((((%time.year% * 16) + %time.month%) * 35) + %time.day%) * 24) + %time.hour% if %last_summon% if %now% - %last_summon% >= 168 set can_summon yes else osend %actor% You may only summon one mount per week! endif else set can_summon yes endif if %can_summon% == yes * The knight doesn't have a mount yet, allow them to get one if %actor.class% == Paladin * Knight is a paladin, give him/her a golden dragon oload mob 18890 oechoaround %actor% A brilliant golden dragon flies in from nowhere, and nuzzles %actor.name%'s side. osend %actor% You begin calling for a mount.. osend %actor% A brilliant golden dragon answers your summons. set summoned yes elseif %actor.class% /= Anti * Knight is an anti-paladin, give him/her a black dragon oload mob 18891 oechoaround %actor% A dusky black dragon flies in, seemingly from nowhere, and sits by %actor.name%'s side. osend %actor% You begin calling for a mount.. osend %actor% A dusky black dragon answers your summons. set summoned yes else osend %actor% You begin calling for a mount...but nothing happens. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% whistles loudly. endif * Saddle up the dragon mount if %summoned% oforce dragon-mount follow %actor.name% oload mob 18892 oforce dragonsquire mload obj 18892 oforce dragonsquire give dragonsaddle dragon-mount oforce dragon-mount wear dragonsaddle opurge dragonsquire * Timestamp quest variable quest_items %actor.name% dragonhelm_time %now% endif endif

triggers.name: dragonsaddle_melt
triggers.commands: if ((%actor.vnum% == 18890) || (%actor.vnum% == 18891)) else return 0 if %actor.canbeseen% osend %actor% As you take hold of %self.shortdesc%, it melts between your fingers. oechoaround %actor% As %actor.name% takes hold of %self.shortdesc%, it melts between %actor.p% fingers. else oecho %self.shortdesc% spontaneously combusts. endif opurge %self% endif

triggers.name: dragonegg_hatch
triggers.commands: switch %cmd% case h case ha return 0 halt done if (%actor.class% == Paladin) set color golden set vnum 18890 elseif (%actor.class% /= Anti) set color black set vnum 18891 else osend %actor% You get the feeling that this egg is not meant for you. endif if %color% osend %actor% As you rub the egg, a crack begins to form... oechoaround %actor% As %actor.name% rubs %self.shortdesc%, a crack begins to form... wait 3s oecho The crack continues to grow, branching into hundreds of smaller cracks! wait 6s oecho A talon suddenly breaks through the egg shell! wait 3s oecho Slowly, the head of a %color% dragon pushes through the shell. wait 2s oecho The dragon egg continues to split into pieces. wait 2s oecho A small, %color% dragon emerges from the broken egg shell. oload mob %vnum% osend %actor% The %color% dragon looks at you. oechoaround %actor% The %color% dragon looks at %actor.name%. wait 3s oforce %color%-dragon bow if (%actor.sex% == Female) oforce %color%-dragon say Mistress, thank you for protecting me. else oforce %color%-dragon say Master, thank you for protecting me. endif oforce %color%-dragon say Henceforth shall I be at your command.  Merely call and I shall answer! wait 5s oforce %color%-dragon emote looks around itself. oecho In a rush of wind, the dragon beats its wings, launching itself into the air. opurge %color%-dragon wait 2s osend %actor% A strange-looking helmet falls from behind the dragon, landing near you. oechoaround %actor% A strange-looking helmet falls from behind the dragon, landing near %actor.name%. oload obj %vnum% if %actor.quest_stage[quest_items]% == 0 quest start quest_items %actor.name% endif quest variable quest_items %actor.name% %vnum% 1 oforce %actor% get dragonhelm opurge %self% endif

To jail %arg.n% goes! osend %actor% You tag %arg.name%, sending %arg.o% to jail! osend %arg% %actor.name% tags you, sending you to jail! oforce %arg% look endif elseif (%arg_same_team% == yes) if (%arg_in_jail% == yes) * Tagging teammate in opponent jail, rescue them oload obj 18897 oheal %arg% 10 oforce %arg% wake oforce %arg% get fiery-tag-bat oteleport %arg% %actor_home% osend %arg% %actor.name% tags you, rescuing you from your imprisonment! oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% tags %arg.name%, returning both of them to their zone! osend %actor% You tag %arg.name%, rescuing %arg.o% from %arg.p% imprisonment! oteleport %actor% %actor_home% oforce %arg% look oforce %actor% look else * Tagging teammate in opponent zone, but not jail, do nothing osend %actor% %arg.name% doesn't need rescuing right now. endif else * Tagging opponent in opponent zone, do nothing osend %actor% No point in tagging %arg.o% if you're not in your zone. endif endif
