rooms.name: Antechamber of the Degree
rooms.description: Once the stone-laden entrance to the cathedral of a great order, many of the religious artifacts and decorations have been removed from the antechamber, leaving only the magnificent limestone architecture behind.  Graceful stone arches line the north and south walls, curving upwards to the vaulted circular ceiling above.  Between each arch a different vestige is displayed, the most noticeable of which is a large painting hanging on the south wall.  Small windows in the ceiling allow the perfect amount of light in, brightening the gleaming white limestone.  The floor is tiled in glossy white marble, with no other decoration besides the shadows cast from the windows above.

East.description: Previously a simple arched doorway to the world beyond the cathedral, a powerful spell of sending has been imbued on the doorway, creating a swirling deep blue vortex at the center of the portal.  It seems stable...  And probably safe.

extras.text: Framed in magnificent silver, the painting depicts a small grouping of dark-cloaked people, In the center, a slender half-elf woman in pale blue robes sits on a black chair, smirking slightly beneath tresses of silvery hair.  To the right, a gnarly gnome dressed in black robes scowls at the painter, his beady black eyes frowning impudently.  On the left, a dashing warrior in shiny armor grins mischievously, resting his right arm casually on a black greatsword on his belt.  On either side of the painting stand lithe, fairly nondescript men in loose, navy garb.  They both smile disarmingly, belying their true vocation.  There is a small inscription at the bottom of the frame.
The inscription reads:&b Dronar, Karde, Kendris, Zenitul, Arreeleo The Clandestine Degree&0
Clouds passing over the cathedral cause the shadows to periodically shift, but at times of equilibrium, the shadows coalesce to the shape of a rearing fox.

rooms.name: Vaulted Rotunda
rooms.description: This atrium's most distinguishing characteristic is its high vaulted ceilings with numerous pointed arches that reach upward from elaborate stone pillars lining the semicircular walls.  Apparently constructed of sturdy limestone, the ceiling puts tremendous weight on its supporting posts, indicated by the great lines of blue steel reinforcing the walls.  The beautiful stone walls wrap around in an arc that opens up to a huge arch leading to the sanctuary to the west.  In the east, a smaller arch leads to the cathedral antechamber, above which a beautiful, tall stained glass window is emplaced.  Unlike typical stained glass windows, this one has primarily muted colors, many of which are blues and grays.  Similar but smaller stained glass windows appear periodically around the upper circumference of the rotunda walls where they meet the vaulted ceiling.  To the north and south, smaller arched doorways open to twin narthexes.  Barely noticeable in the center of the checkered marble floor is the vague shape of a fox, made up of a slightly darker, bluish marble.

extras.text: The wall encompasses the entire circular room, wide stone columns rising every few armwidths from the floor to meet pointed arches leading up to the center of the domed ceiling above.  Light lines of blue steel are inserted between columns, tastefully adding to the walls' solid blocks of stone.  Atop each column rests a small gargoyle, peering down upon the rotunda with piercing stone eyes.

About four times a man's height, the window reaches high above in a somewhat rounded arch.  Its colored glass is almost exclusively blue and gray, depicting the image of a blue fox against a murky grayish background.  The fox is rearing up on its hind legs, reaching up viciously towards an amethyst-hued raptor flittering above it.  In the bird's mouth, a small golden olive leaf is clasped tightly, hanging just out of the fox's reach.

rooms.name: Chamber of Vigilance
rooms.description: Two columns of polished wooden pews sit in rows facing the northern end of the chamber, an aisle in the center leading up to the pulpit at the front of the room.  Behind the pulpit, a large frosted window sports partially closed violet curtains, obscuring the view of outdoors, obfuscating the view of outside.  Nevertheless, a large bronze telescope with an undoubtedly horrid view stands on a tripod before the window, pointed at its murky pane.  The violet shade of the curtains is repeated around the room, purple and silver wallpaper coating the walls and violet streaks of amethyst running through the white marble in the floor.  Large limestone shelves are carved hewn in the walls and lined with numerous books, giving this chamber the impression of a lecture chapel.

South.description: Two large wooden doors are emplaced in the southern wall.  Small silver handles, fixed about chest high, stand out on each door.

extras.text: Although the telescope is pointed at the opaque window before it, looking through the viewfinder reveals a startlingly clear view of the Village of Mielikki, as if one were looking down upon it.  It might even be possible to observe individual rooms from this perspective.

rooms.name: Quiet Seclusion
rooms.description: Beautiful maple shelves lined with all manner of books line every wall in the room, broken only by a large frosted window in the south wall.  The window is decorated by rich cobalt drapery, matching the lighter steel blue of the painted ceiling.  Rising from the lavish carpeted floor to the ceiling twice a man's height above, the shelves hold hundreds of different books, apprarently organized by seniority.  Arranged in a semi-circle in the center of the room, four comfortable looking easy chairs rest interspersed with burnished wooden side-tables.  Beautiful ivory oil-burning lamps rest upon each table, casting a soft light upon the chairs around them and making for a very pleasing study atmosphere.  To the south, the tall wooden doors lead back to the echoing marble narthex outside.

North.description: Standing twice as high as an average man, the tall wooden doors seem gargantuan compared to the small silver handles at each's center.  A silvery blue metal is inlaid in a rectangle in each door.

extras.text: The shelves wrap around the room's walls, literally covered in books from all eras of time.  Starting just to the east of the doors, the oldest books rest in magical stasis, looking as though they might crumble under the slightest touch. The books continue around the room ending just west of the doors, where the newest books of the realm are collected.  A tall metal ladder is mounted on a rail at the top of the shelves, able to slide completely around the room, providing easy access to even the highest books.

rooms.name: Marble Narthex
rooms.description: Large slabs of grayish white marble line the walls of the room, streaks of blue running periodically through its cloudy surface.  The polished marble complements the limestone around it, the shades of gray and blue crossing each other in an intricate geological dance.  Above, the semicylindrical arch of the limestone ceiling radiates peacefulness, its dark blue inlaid lapis glinting playfully in the light.  Large, frosted glass windows line the east wall, their translucent glass obstructing the view of the cathedral exterior.  A large, open arched doorway peers into the rotunda to the south, and twin sets of tall wooden doors rest in the north and west walls.

North.description: The large wooden double doors stand twice the height of a man, dwarfing the small silver handles on each door.  Each door is decorated by a silvery blue metal inlaid in a rectangle around the center.

West.description: The large wooden double doors stand twice the height of a man, dwarfing the small silver handles on each door.  Each door is decorated by polished lapis lazuli inlaid in a rectangle around the center.

rooms.name: Chamber of Sending
rooms.description: Decoration in this chamber is sparse, the white painted walls creating a very sterile atmosphere in the room.  An indigo trim runs along the upper edge of the walls, broken periodically by candle-holders.  In the center of the room, a huge oak table rests ponderously, with various papers and artifacts resting on it.  Circling the room in a large bent arc, a band of tall, ring-shaped portals stand silently, their matte indigo surfaces absorbing nearly all the light that hit them.  A pair of tall wooden doors lies in the east wall's white face, rising twice the height of a man.

North.description: This tall ring-shaped portal encircles the hazy image of a bluish town square, it's visage shrouded in flurries of snow.

East.description: The wooden doors stand tall, swinging easily on well-oiled black hinges. Small silver handles, fixed about chest high, stand out on each door.

South.description: The south ring contains the dusty image of a busy city center nestled in high mountains.  Numerous short and stout humanoids can be seen walking the streets.

West.description: The interior of this portal is almost completely dark.  Deep in the murky blackness, scattered lightning can be seen, illuminating a quiet stone gate.

extras.text: Nothing.

The heavy oak table is circular, with a single, wide support beneath it.  In the center of the table, the image of a rearing fox is etched lightly in the wood.  Various papers and trinkets are strewn across the table, many bearing a seal similar to the imprint on the table.  A small collection of indigo-colored papers has silver writing on them.

rooms.name: Marble Narthex
rooms.description: The walls of the room are lined with large slabs of grayish white marble with streaks of blue running periodically through its cloudy surface.  The marble's shades of gray and blue complement the limestone around it, meeting in an intricate geological dance.  Peacefulness radiates from the semicylindrical arch of the limestone ceiling above, its dark blue inlaid lapis glinting peacefully in the light.  Along the east wall, frosted glass windows allow light into the room, but obstruct the view of the cathedral exterior.  A large open arched doorway peers into the rotunda to the north, and twin sets of tall wooden doors rest in the south and west walls.

South.description: The large wooden doors stand twice the height of a man, dwarfing the small silver handles on each door.  Each one is decorated by a silvery blue metal inlaid in a rectangle around the center.

West.description: The large wooden double doors stand twice the height of a man, dwarfing the small silver handles on each door.  Each one is decorated by polished lapis lazuli inlaid in a rectangle around the center.

rooms.name: Supplies Repository
rooms.description: A dry, musky odor permeates the air, rising from the light layer of dust covering nearly everything.  The room is marginally lit; having no windows, there are only lamps hanging periodically from the ceiling to provide light. Two large wooden doors lie in the east wall, rising high above a human's height.  Facing the doors, a large desk rests near the entrance, standing between it and the supplies filling the room.  Four aisles of sturdy wooden shelves are lined up behind the desk, well-stocked with all manner of necessity as well as frivolity.  The room's walls and ceiling are a fairly drab stone gray, looking as if they might have once been decorated.  Carpeting from before remains, a thick incarnadine plush, hinting of the stockroom's onetime resplendent history.

East.description: The wooden doors rise quite a bit above a man's height, chest-high tarnished silver handles fixed in the centers.  Black metal hinges attach each door to the frame around the doors.

rooms.name: Degree Assembly
rooms.description: Huge vaulted ceilings soar high above the gray marble floor, creating a vast echoing expanse, once a wealthy religious order's sanctum.  Remnants of their theology remain in beautiful carvings and inscriptions in limestone walls and pillars.  The graceful vaulted white limestone ceiling is decorated by thousands of tiny embedded ultramarine-hued lapis, creating a glinting inverted starfield.  Soft glowing lamps are fixed atop each pillar, casting their light upon the polished surfaces of the marble floors and throwing dark shadows behind the rows of pillars.  Lightly stained in the gray marble, the dark blue image of a rearing fox is drawn where the pews of the sanctuary once sat. Outside the rows of pillars, some of the limestone pews remain, facing inwards to the hall like audience seating.  Huge glazed stained glass windows line the outer walls behind the pews, many of them dark blue or gray, allowing in little light and giving the hall a rather somber mood.  At the east end of the hall, a huge arch opens the hall to the rotunda and the remainder of the cathedral. From that end, the altar can cleary be seen on the other end, a low marble dais with several blue throne-like seatings.

rooms.name: The FieryTag Command Center
rooms.description: Strange boxes of light line the back wall of the room, images flashing across their faces.  Many of the images seem to act like crystal balls, seeming to follow people, all of whom are wielding long bat-shaped sticks.  The opposite side of the room has huge bay windows, somehow overlooking the whole of Caelia.  Every nook and cranny can be seen from the windows' view, all appearing to be the same distance away.  Voices are emitted from a tiny black box hanging from the ceiling, excitedly describing the images in the boxes in the back of the room.
